cities.context: This city wa the first capital of the United States after the Constitution was ratified in 1788.
This is the only North American city to host the olympics twice.
This city is home to the world's tallest building designed by a female.
This city is home to one of the world's tallest steel arch bridges in the world.
The city is home to the world's largest stained-glass ceiling.
During WW2 this city became the busiest submarine port in the world.
The only pan-continental city in the world situated on two continents, Europe and Asia.
The smallest city in all of England.
This city is home to the most visited zoo in all of Europe.
This city is home to Asia's largest spice and wholesale fruits and vegetables market.
